required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Long-term Safety of SPD422 in Japanese Adults With Essential Thrombocythaemia
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase 3, Multi-centre, Open-label, Extension Study to Investigate the Long-term Safety of SPD422 in Japanese Adults With Essential Thrombocythaemia

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to provide SPD422 to subjects who completed Study SPD422 308 and, in the opinion of the Investigator, will continue to benefit from treatment.

primary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Platelet Count at Final Assessment
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and final assessment (within 5 days of the last dose of investigational product)
primary_outcome.description: Baseline considered from study SPD422-308 (NCT01214915). Final assessment was defined as the last non-missing data (End of study visit in SPD422-309 [NCT01467661], or early termination visit either in SPD422-308 [NCT01214915] or SPD422-309 [NCT01467661], or last available study visit).

primary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Platelet Count During Post-marketing Trial at Final Assessment
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and final assessment (within 5 days of the last dose of investigational product)
primary_outcome.description: Baseline considered from study SPD422-308 (NCT01214915). Final assessment was defined as the last non-missing data (End of study visit in SPD422-309 [NCT01467661], or early termination visit either in SPD422-308 [NCT01214915] or SPD422-309 [NCT01467661], or last available study visit).

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants Who Achieved Platelet Count Less Than (<) 600
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, Week 1, Month 1-12, 15, 18, 21, 24, 27, 30, 33, 36, 39, 42, 45, 48, and final assessment (within 5 days of the last dose of investigational product)
primary_outcome.description: Baseline considered from study SPD422-308 (NCT01214915). Final assessment was defined as the last non-missing data (End of study visit in SPD422-309 [NCT01467661], or early termination visit either in SPD422-308 [NCT01214915] or SPD422-309 [NCT01467661], or last available study visit). Participants who achieved platelet count <600 x 10^9 platelets per liter at each visit were reported.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants Who Achieved Platelet Count Less Than (<) 600 During Post-marketing Trial
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and final assessment (within 5 days of the last dose of investigational product)
primary_outcome.description: Baseline considered from study SPD422-308 (NCT01214915). Final assessment was defined as the last non-missing data (End of study visit in SPD422-309 [NCT01467661], or early termination visit either in SPD422-308 [NCT01214915] or SPD422-309 [NCT01467661], or last available study visit). Participants who achieved platelet count <600 x 10^9 platelets per liter during the post-marketing trial were reported.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants Who Achieved Shift From Baseline in Platelet Count
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and final assessment (within 5 days of the last dose of investigational product)
primary_outcome.description: Baseline considered from study SPD422-308 (NCT01214915). Final assessment (FA) was defined as the last non-missing data (End of study visit in SPD422-309 [NCT01467661], or early termination visit either in SPD422-308 [NCT01214915] or SPD422-309 [NCT01467661], or last available study visit). Participants who had platelet count <600 x 10^9 platelet per liter and greater than equal (>=) 600 x 10^9 platelet per liter at the final assessment as a shift from baseline was reported. Percentage of participants with shift = number of participants with shift / Safety analysis set (53 participants) * 100.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants Who Achieved Shift From Baseline in Platelet Count During Post-marketing Trial
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and final assessment (within 5 days of the last dose of investigational product)
primary_outcome.description: Baseline considered from study SPD422-308 (NCT01214915). Final assessment (FA) was defined as the last non-missing data (End of study visit in SPD422-309 [NCT01467661], or early termination visit either in SPD422-308 [NCT01214915] or SPD422-309 [NCT01467661], or last available study visit). Participants who had platelet count <600 x 10^9 platelet per liter and greater than equal (>=) 600 x 10^9 platelet per liter at the final assessment as a shift from baseline during the post marketing trial was reported. Percentage of participants with shift = number of participants with shift / post-marketing safety analysis set (33 participants) * 100.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Treatment-emergent Adverse Events (TEAEs) and Treatment-emergent Serious Adverse Events (TESAEs)
primary_outcome.time_frame: From start of study treatment (SPD422-308) up to 12 days after the last dose of investigational product
primary_outcome.description: An adverse event (AE) was any untoward medical occurrence in a participant who received study drug without regard to possibility of causal relationship. A serious adverse event (SAE) was an AE resulting in any of the following outcomes or deemed significant for any other reason: death; initial or prolonged in-patient hospitalization; life-threatening experience (immediate risk of dying); persistent or significant disability/incapacity; congenital anomaly. Treatment-emergent adverse event was defined as the onset of any AE or if the severity of a pre-existing AE worsened any time on or after the date of first dose of investigational product in Study SPD422-308 (NCT01214915) and up to and including 12 days after the last dose is taken.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With TEAEs and TESAEs During Post-marketing Trial
primary_outcome.time_frame: From start of study treatment (SPD422-308) up to 12 days after the last dose of investigational product
primary_outcome.description: An AE was any untoward medical occurrence in a participant who received study drug without regard to possibility of causal relationship. SAE was an AE resulting in any of the following outcomes or deemed significant for any other reason: death; initial or prolonged in-patient hospitalization; life-threatening experience (immediate risk of dying); persistent or significant disability/incapacity; congenital anomaly. Treatment-emergent adverse event was defined as the onset of any AE or if the severity of a pre-existing AE worsened any time on or after the date of first dose of investigational product in Study SPD422-308 (NCT01214915) and up to and including 12 days after the last dose is taken.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With TEAEs and TESAEs Related to Clinical Laboratory Result
primary_outcome.time_frame: From start of study treatment (SPD422-308) up to 12 days after the last dose of investigational product
primary_outcome.description: An AE was any untoward medical occurrence in a participant who received study drug without regard to possibility of causal relationship. SAE was an AE resulting in any of the following outcomes or deemed significant for any other reason: death; initial or prolonged in-patient hospitalization; life-threatening experience (immediate risk of dying); persistent or significant disability/incapacity; congenital anomaly. Treatment-emergent adverse event was defined as the onset of any AE or if the severity of a pre-existing AE worsened any time on or after the date of first dose of investigational product in Study SPD422-308 (NCT01214915) and up to and including 12 days after the last dose is taken. Clinical Laboratory analysis included hematology, biochemistry, and urinalysis.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With TEAEs and TESAEs Related to Clinical Laboratory Result During Post-marketing Trial
primary_outcome.time_frame: From start of study treatment (SPD422-308) up to 12 days after the last dose of investigational product
primary_outcome.description: An AE was any untoward medical occurrence in a participant who received study drug without regard to possibility of causal relationship. SAE was an AE resulting in any of the following outcomes or deemed significant for any other reason: death; initial or prolonged in-patient hospitalization; life-threatening experience (immediate risk of dying); persistent or significant disability/incapacity; congenital anomaly. Treatment-emergent adverse event was defined as the onset of any AE or if the severity of a pre-existing AE worsened any time on or after the date of first dose of investigational product in Study SPD422-308 (NCT01214915) and up to and including 12 days after the last dose is taken. Clinical Laboratory analysis included hematology, biochemistry, and urinalysis.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With TEAEs and TESAEs Related to Vital Signs
primary_outcome.time_frame: From start of study treatment (SPD422-308) up to 12 days after the last dose of investigational product
primary_outcome.description: An AE was any untoward medical occurrence in a participant who received study drug without regard to possibility of causal relationship. SAE was an AE resulting in any of the following outcomes or deemed significant for any other reason: death; initial or prolonged in-patient hospitalization; life-threatening experience (immediate risk of dying); persistent or significant disability/incapacity; congenital anomaly. Treatment-emergent adverse event was defined as the onset of any AE or if the severity of a pre-existing AE worsened any time on or after the date of first dose of investigational product in Study SPD422-308 (NCT01214915) and up to and including 12 days after the last dose is taken. Vital signs included pulse rate, systolic and diastolic blood pressure, and weight.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With TEAEs and TESAEs Related to Vital Signs During Post-marketing Trial
primary_outcome.time_frame: From start of study treatment (SPD422-308) up to 12 days after the last dose of investigational product
primary_outcome.description: An AE was any untoward medical occurrence in a participant who received study drug without regard to possibility of causal relationship. SAE was an AE resulting in any of the following outcomes or deemed significant for any other reason: death; initial or prolonged in-patient hospitalization; life-threatening experience (immediate risk of dying); persistent or significant disability/incapacity; congenital anomaly. Treatment-emergent adverse event was defined as the onset of any AE or if the severity of a pre-existing AE worsened any time on or after the date of first dose of investigational product in Study SPD422-308 (NCT01214915) and up to and including 12 days after the last dose is taken. Vital signs included pulse rate, systolic and diastolic blood pressure, and weight.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Clinically Significant Electrocardiogram (ECG) Abnormalities
primary_outcome.time_frame: From start of study treatment (SPD422-308) up to 12 days after the last dose of investigational product
primary_outcome.description: Standard 12-Lead ECG analysis was performed to identify the ECG abnormalities. Clinically significant abnormalities like QT prolongation, atrial fibrillation, were decided by the investigator during the study.

intervention.description: Subjects will be continued on the dose of anagrelide that controlled their platelet levels in Study 308 and titrated if necessary.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Subjects must have completed Study SPD422 308

facility.name: Tokyo Metropolitan Cancer and Infectious diseases Center Kom

participant_flow.recruitment_details: The study was conducted in 15 centers in the Japan between 27 October 2010 and 01 May 2015.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Overall 53 participants were enrolled in study SPD422-308 (NCT01214915), 42 of them completed the study. Of these 42 participants, 41 entered in to the current extension study SPD422-309 (NCT01467661) with 33 of 41 participants entered the post marketing trial and 32 participants completed the study (after marketing approval was granted).

group.title: SPD422 (Anagrelide Hydrochloride)
group.description: Participants received anagrelide hydrochloride (SPD422) tablet orally at a dose of 1.0 milligram (mg) per day and titrated as necessary with a maximum single dose of 2.5 mg, total daily dose not more than 10 mg and total dosage increment should not exceed 0.5 mg per day in any week of treatment.

baseline.population: Safety analysis set included all enrolled participants who had taken at least 1 dose of SPD422 since enrolment into Study SPD422-308 (NCT01214915).

group.title: SPD422 (Anagrelide Hydrochloride)
group.description: Participants received anagrelide hydrochloride (SPD422) tablet orally at a dose of 1.0 milligram (mg) per day and titrated as necessary with a maximum single dose of 2.5 mg, total daily dose not more than 10 mg and total dosage increment should not exceed 0.5 mg per day in any week of treatment.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in Platelet Count at Final Assessment
outcome.description: Baseline considered from study SPD422-308 (NCT01214915). Final assessment was defined as the last non-missing data (End of study visit in SPD422-309 [NCT01467661], or early termination visit either in SPD422-308 [NCT01214915] or SPD422-309 [NCT01467661], or last available study visit).
outcome.time_frame: Baseline and final assessment (within 5 days of the last dose of investigational product)
outcome.population: Safety analysis set included all enrolled participants who had taken at least 1 dose of SPD422 since enrolment into Study SPD422-308 (NCT01214915).

outcome.population: Post-marketing trial safety analysis set included all participants in the safety analysis set who continued into the post-marketing part of study SPD422-309 (NCT01467661). Here, n = number of participants analysed at specific time point.

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants With Treatment-emergent Adverse Events (TEAEs) and Treatment-emergent Serious Adverse Events (TESAEs)
outcome.description: An adverse event (AE) was any untoward medical occurrence in a participant who received study drug without regard to possibility of causal relationship. A serious adverse event (SAE) was an AE resulting in any of the following outcomes or deemed significant for any other reason: death; initial or prolonged in-patient hospitalization; life-threatening experience (immediate risk of dying); persistent or significant disability/incapacity; congenital anomaly. Treatment-emergent adverse event was defined as the onset of any AE or if the severity of a pre-existing AE worsened any time on or after the date of first dose of investigational product in Study SPD422-308 (NCT01214915) and up to and including 12 days after the last dose is taken.
outcome.time_frame: From start of study treatment (SPD422-308) up to 12 days after the last dose of investigational product
outcome.population: Safety analysis set included all enrolled participants who had taken at least 1 dose of SPD422 since enrolment into Study SPD422-308 (NCT01214915).

outcome.description: An AE was any untoward medical occurrence in a participant who received study drug without regard to possibility of causal relationship. SAE was an AE resulting in any of the following outcomes or deemed significant for any other reason: death; initial or prolonged in-patient hospitalization; life-threatening experience (immediate risk of dying); persistent or significant disability/incapacity; congenital anomaly. Treatment-emergent adverse event was defined as the onset of any AE or if the severity of a pre-existing AE worsened any time on or after the date of first dose of investigational product in Study SPD422-308 (NCT01214915) and up to and including 12 days after the last dose is taken. Clinical Laboratory analysis included hematology, biochemistry, and urinalysis.
outcome.time_frame: From start of study treatment (SPD422-308) up to 12 days after the last dose of investigational product
outcome.population: Post-marketing trial safety analysis set included all participants in the safety analysis set who continued into the post-marketing part of study SPD422-309 (NCT01467661).

group.title: SPD422 (Anagrelide Hydrochloride)
group.description: Participants received anagrelide hydrochloride (SPD422) tablet orally at a dose of 1.0 mg per day and titrated as necessary with a maximum single dose of 2.5 mg, total daily dose not more than 10 mg and total dosage increment should not exceed 0.5 mg per day in any week of treatment.

measure.title: Percentage of Participants With TEAEs and TESAEs Related to Clinical Laboratory Result During Post-marketing Trial
measure.description: An AE was any untoward medical occurrence in a participant who received study drug without regard to possibility of causal relationship. SAE was an AE resulting in any of the following outcomes or deemed significant for any other reason: death; initial or prolonged in-patient hospitalization; life-threatening experience (immediate risk of dying); persistent or significant disability/incapacity; congenital anomaly. Treatment-emergent adverse event was defined as the onset of any AE or if the severity of a pre-existing AE worsened any time on or after the date of first dose of investigational product in Study SPD422-308 (NCT01214915) and up to and including 12 days after the last dose is taken. Clinical Laboratory analysis included hematology, biochemistry, and urinalysis.
measure.population: Post-marketing trial safety analysis set included all participants in the safety analysis set who continued into the post-marketing part of study SPD422-309 (NCT01467661).

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants With TEAEs and TESAEs Related to Vital Signs
outcome.description: An AE was any untoward medical occurrence in a participant who received study drug without regard to possibility of causal relationship. SAE was an AE resulting in any of the following outcomes or deemed significant for any other reason: death; initial or prolonged in-patient hospitalization; life-threatening experience (immediate risk of dying); persistent or significant disability/incapacity; congenital anomaly. Treatment-emergent adverse event was defined as the onset of any AE or if the severity of a pre-existing AE worsened any time on or after the date of first dose of investigational product in Study SPD422-308 (NCT01214915) and up to and including 12 days after the last dose is taken. Vital signs included pulse rate, systolic and diastolic blood pressure, and weight.
outcome.time_frame: From start of study treatment (SPD422-308) up to 12 days after the last dose of investigational product
outcome.population: Safety analysis set included all enrolled participants who had taken at least 1 dose of SPD422 since enrolment into Study SPD422-308 (NCT01214915).

outcome.title: Number of Participants With Clinically Significant Electrocardiogram (ECG) Abnormalities
outcome.description: Standard 12-Lead ECG analysis was performed to identify the ECG abnormalities. Clinically significant abnormalities like QT prolongation, atrial fibrillation, were decided by the investigator during the study.
outcome.time_frame: From start of study treatment (SPD422-308) up to 12 days after the last dose of investigational product
outcome.population: Safety analysis set included all enrolled participants who had taken at least 1 dose of SPD422 since enrolment into Study SPD422-308 (NCT01214915).

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: If a multicenter publication is not submitted within twelve (12) months after conclusion, abandonment or termination of the Study at all sites, or after Sponsor confirms there shall be no multicenter Study publication, the Institution and/or such Principal Investigator may publish the results from the Institution site individually.
